ACCOUNTANT

SUMMARY

Financial Accountant specializing in financial planning, reporting and analysis in both private and public sectors.Capable Accountant successful at managing multiple projects and consistently meeting deadlines under pressure.
Extensive knowledge of accounting software and processes.
Highlights
Account reconciliation expert General ledger accounting working on SAP tool and HFM Account payable Specialist Auditing
Expert in customer relations Flexible team player Compliance testing knowledge

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Achieved cost reduction by eliminating redundant processes.
Operated computers programmed with accounting software to record, store, and analyze information.
Extensive experience with Financial Statements audits, reviews, compilations and audits for Governmental organizations (A-133).
Maintained accurate accounts including cash, inventory, prepaid, fixed assets, accounts payable, accrued expenses and line of credit transactions.
Researched and resolved billing problems that had been previously missed.Reduced the open invoice cycle time from days developing new dispute reporting procedures.

EXPERIENCE

Performs routine accounting activities such as maintenance of the general ledger, preparation of various accounting statements and financial reports and accounts payable or receivable functions.
Accounts Receivable experience with focus in Cash Application and/or Adjustments Process day to day AP; to include matching, reviewing for proper approvals and G/L coding, researching and entering invoices.
HFM reporting including balance sheet profit and loss statement etc.
Run weekly checks, match, mail and file copies.
Prepare weekly cash requirements report.
Work closely with other departments and outside vendors.
Maintain vendor files.
Assist with month-end account reconciliations and journal entries.
Cross train with A/R to process invoices and deposits Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
May lead and direct the work of others.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Accounting Manager

Location: Dallas, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Compensation: $175,000-$200,000
Company Overview:Our client, a prominent leader in the retail food industry, operates a widespread network of outlets across the globe. Known for their commitment to quality and innovation, they are dedicated to enhancing consumer experiences and continuously adapting to market trends. As part of their mission to refine and expand their financial operations, they are seeking a seasoned Senior Manager, Accounting to guide their accounting team and ensure excellence in financial processes.About This Opportunity:Job Summary:The Senior Manager, Accounting is responsible for managing the organization’s inventory accounting and cost of goods sold, ensuring accuracy and compliance with financial regulations. This role is pivotal in enhancing financial procedures and reports, contributing to the company's overall financial health.Key Duties and Responsibilities:Oversee the completeness and accuracy of financial information relating to inventory and cost transactions.Implement process improvements to streamline inventory and merchandise payables operations.Collaborate across departments to troubleshoot and resolve financial discrepancies and optimize financial reporting.Develop and maintain robust internal controls and compliance with accounting principles.Lead the month-end close process, ensuring timely and accurate financial reconciliations.Provide strategic leadership to the accounting team, fostering skill development and career progression.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a closely related field.At least 10 years of accounting experience, with 5+ years in a managerial role within the retail or food industry.Strong understanding of GAAP and other relevant accounting standards.Proficient in using advanced financial software systems and Microsoft Excel.Exceptional analytical, organizational, and leadership skills.Excellent communication abilities to effectively manage internal and external stakeholder relationships.Why Join Us?Our client is not just a leader in the retail food space; they are innovators looking to push the boundaries of what is possible in their industry. They offer:A competitive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance.Generous paid time off and flexible working conditions.A supportive environment that fosters professional growth and development.Opportunities to impact the company's strategic financial decisions.Join Our Vision:This role is ideal for a strategic thinker who is passionate about driving financial accuracy and operational efficiency in a fast-paced industry. If you are looking for a challenging role that combines leadership with detailed financial management, consider joining our client's team in Dallas, TX.

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
